snippet: When HP splits after a year of planning, what is left will bear little resemblance to the engineering-driven company founded more than 75 years ago.
abstract: Hewlett-Packard, firm that helped start phenomenon of Silicon Valley, is splitting into two companies; HP Inc will feature personal computers and printers, and Hewlett Packard Enterprise will market software, data storage and other services; chief executive Meg Whitman will head HP Enterprise; each company is forecast to have annual revenue of $50 billion.
lead_paragraph: When HP splits after a year of planning, what is left will bear little resemblance to the engineering-driven company founded more than 75 years ago.

headline.main: Meg Whitman Seeks Reinvention for HP as It Prepares for Split
headline.print_headline: Splitting Up a Tech Icon to Save It
